intro: Psiadia tsaratananensis, commonly known as the Madagascar daisy, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the region's unique climate. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Psiadia tsaratananensis is of interest to botanists due to its endemic status and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
